file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-01-06-04 - PASSENGER SEAT TRACKS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER SEAT TRACKS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Passenger Seat Tracks. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 53-01-06-000-801-A PASSENGER SEAT TRACKS - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) PASSENGER SEAT TRACKS - INSTALLA- 53-01-06-400-801-A EMB-135 TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. PASSENGER SEAT TRACKS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Passenger Seat Tracks. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 53-01-00 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-02-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400 - IPC 53-01-00 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 230 Fuselage center section I 240 Fuselage center section II 250 Fuselage center section III 260 Fuselage center section IV D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the floor available Commercially Acrylic spatula To remove the sealant available Commercially Torque wrench To remove the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 2 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM - D740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - (MEK) AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Floor 53-01-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin, RH/LH I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-008-B (1) Remove the passenger seat (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400). (2) To remove the center seat track, remove floor panels as necessary to get access to hold the seat track nuts AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400. (3) To remove the lateral seat track, remove the skirting linings panels as necessary to get access to hold the seat track nuts AMM TASK 25-23-02-000-801-A/400. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-008-B (1) For aircraft S/N 551, 599 and on, refer to Figure 403 and do as follows: (a) With an acrylic spatula, remove the old sealant from the track. (2) Remove the nuts (4), washers (3), and screws (2) that attach the tracks (1) to the passenger cabin floor and to the lateral structure. (3) For aircraft with configuration VIP A and VIP B , refer to Figure 402 and do as follows: (a) Remove the nut (4), washer (3), washers (5), and screws (2) that attach the tracks (1) to the passenger cabin floor and to the lateral structure. NOTE: In configuration VIP A, the washer is yellow and, in configuration VIP B, the washer is green. (4) Remove the tracks (1). NOTE: Before the removal, identify the location of each track to make sure that it is installed back in the same position where it was removed from, according to IPC 53-01-00. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 3 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (5) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 4 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 Passenger Seat Tracks - Removal/Installation Figure 401 1 3 B ZONES 2. SCREW 231 241/242 251/252 1. TRACK 261/262 2 BUTT STRAP A ZONES 231 241/242 251/252 261/262 DET. A 3. WASHER POST-MOD SB 145-53-0041 1 3 2. SCREW 4. NUT 1. TRACK 1 3 2. SCREW 1. TRACK 2 3. WASHER DET. B 2 4. NUT (TYPICAL) DET. A PRE-MOD SB 145-53-0041 3. WASHER 1 SOAK THE SCREW IN COR-BAN 27L. 2 APPLY COR-BAN 27L. 4. NUT 3 TORQUE: (4.75 ÃÂ± 0.23) N.m [ (42 ÃÂ± 2) lbf.in]. SCREW A ZONES 231 4 241/242 5. WASHER 251/252 261/262 2 1. TRACK 1 3 2. SCREW 1. TRACK BUTT STRAP DET. A 3. WASHER 2 3. WASHER 4. NUT DET. B 4. NUT (TYPICAL) 1 SOAK THE SCREW IN COR-BAN 27L. 2 APPLY COR-BAN 27L. 3 TORQUE: (4.75 ÃÂ± 0.23) N.m [ (42 ÃÂ± 2) lbf.in]. 4 IN CONFIGURATION VIP A, THE WASHER IS EM145AMM530351A.DGN YELLOW AND, IN CONFIGURATION VIP B, THE WASHER IS GREEN. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. PASSENGER SEAT TRACKS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Passenger Seat Tracks. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 53-01-00 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-02-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400 - CPM 51-21-04 - IPC 53-01-00 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 230 Fuselage center section I 240 Fuselage center section II 250 Fuselage center section III 260 Fuselage center section IV D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the floor available Commercially Acrylic spatula To apply the sealant available Commercially Torque wrench To install screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 8 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM - D740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - (MEK) AR MIL-PRF-81733 Sealant, P/S 870-C12 AR MEP 09-074 THIXOFLEX TG 2010 AR MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR MIL-C-5541 Alodine 1200S AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Floor 53-01-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin, RH/LH I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 420-008-B WARNING: COR-BAN 27L CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE GLOVES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (1) Apply COR-BAN 27L between the butt strap and the track. Refer to (Figure 401) and (Figure 402); DET. A. (2) Position the tracks (1). NOTE: • Make sure that the track is back to the same location as that from which it was removed, according to IPC 53-01-00. • If the seat tracks are not drilled, use the floor holes as a reference to drill them, and apply alodine to the drilled holes according to CPM 51-21-04. WARNING: COR-BAN 27L CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE GLOVES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (3) Install the screws (2), washers (3), and nuts (4). The screw must be wet with COR- BAN 27-L. NOTE: In configuration VIP A, the washer is yellow and, in configuration VIP B, the washer is green. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 9 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) For aircraft with configuration VIP A and VIP B , refer to (Figure 402) and do as follows: (a) Install the washers (5), screws (2), washers (3), and nuts (4). The screw must be wet with COR-BAN 27-L. NOTE: In configuration VIP A, the washer is yellow and, in configuration VIP B, the washer is green. (5) Apply the torque to the screws (2) as given in (Figure 401) or (Figure 402). (6) For aircraft S/N 551, 599 and on, refer to (Figure 403) and do as follows: WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (a) With a clean cloth soaked in MEK, clean the track and the area where the sealant will be applied. (b) Apply the sealing compound (Thixoflex TG2010). Refer to (Figure 403). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-008-B (1) Install the passenger seat (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Install the floor panels AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400. (3) Install the skirting linings panels AMM TASK 25-23-02-400-801-A/400. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-06 Page 10 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
